intro: Cystostemon ethiopicus, commonly known as the Ethiopian starleaf, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale pink in color. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
